page.title: 05CONONLEY LEAD MINE:2
page.content:
The closure of the mine _______________________ The mine ceased to be productive in 1869 with the raising of 130 tons. William Hudson took the job of caretaker when the mine started to be run on a care and maintainance basis.Lead was only mined to meet orders after 1869. For example in 1871 12 tons were mined, and three years later in 1874 20 tons were mined. Nothing was mined during the period in between. When the mine closed a few small companies began to mine for barytes, which was once a waste product but is used today in the paper and rubber industry as a filling agent.
Restoration work is now being undertaken by{Earby Mine Museum.}
